job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Watertown, NY
pros:
-Guaranteed Hours
 [lots of overtime to pick up or be mandated into]
-Full suite of benefits health, dental, vision, retirement, and Disability.
-fast accrual of Pro usually able to take several weeks off throughout the year.
cons:
-Low Pay 15hr base for cna' s 
-awful resident to staff ratio's 1:13 not 
uncommon.
-management does not appreciate staff and disregards our input.
-Administration is disrespectful
 [to the point that during union negotiations a rule that management must use respectful language towards staff was reffused]
-rules only apply to certain people.
-events that should be reported to state are often swept under the rug and hidden.
-Workplace culture is like a toxic high school.
-sexual harassment staff v staff ignored

job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse (LPN) in Watertown, NY
pros: Higher pay than most of the surrounding area. Close to home.
cons: Yearly raise ranges from 1-3%. They have not made enough to make a difference and have not adjusted rates to meet inflation. There is no communication between management and their employees except for the bare minimum. Their "occurrence" system for call-ins and late employees is broken. They only count towards the hourly employees. Those who are salary do not get docked; if they do, HR does nothing about it.

pros: I left before I lost my mind
cons: I experienced racism so bad at this company. When it was reported to upper management they stated” Watertown is not use to diversity “. It doesn’t take a rocket scientist to know how to treat people. I had patients not come to me to get help because I was black, I had patients call me a “black beep” and management did nothing. In fact there were racist things said buy my coworker also. I went to HR and they just moved me to a different and stuck me in the office. The lady I was going to work with in the new department didn’t want to work with me because I was black. Nothing was done, in fact the manager I had at the previous department… they promoted him and moved him to the building I went to. I eventually quit because I got tired of being discriminated against and not heard. I was also tired of looking at the manager I had issues with everyday. If YOU ARE BLACK RUN. THE MOMENT YOU SPEAK UP FOR YOURSELF YOU ARE THE ANGRY BLACK PERSON THATS CRAZY. RUN!!

pros: Flexible hrs and outgoing co-workers
cons: Sometimes hard to get a break, Never know where your gonna be until you get there and it can change last minute or during your shift. Hiring manager is all front and center and present during onboarding process then seems to fade away once the papers are signed.

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Watertown, NY
pros: The only pros are some residents and the fact that you get paid
cons: They treat all cna workers like crap, and you’re supposed to just take it.. very clique based and is where ppl sleep around w each other and I’m sure all the good reviews listed here are ONLY because ppl know ppl and it’s favoritism (it’s all about who you know) lastly if you are African American DONT WORK HERE unless you take passive aggression and racial slurs lightly. (Is that your real hair?, why are you angry?, can I touch your hair?, why aren’t there that many black ppl living in senior homes? (yes, I was asked that) it’s hostile and management only bends the rules of it’s beneficial for them. Everybody talks about everybody

job_title: Nursing Home Administrator in Watertown, NY
pros: This is my first position in leadership on such a large scale, and I can honestly say I have felt extremely supported by my peers and the Senior Leadership Team. Samaritan has welcomed me with open arms and genuine gratitude, all while on boarding me smack in the middle of a global pandemic. I am so great full for the opportunity to work in an organization that values its leaders and their care teams. Career development and advancement is encouraged and the “grow your own” mentality has helped to retain team members for decades, paving the way for rookies in the organization to learn from the wealth of knowledge they can provide. If you are looking for an organization to call home, look no further!
cons: Working within a health system with several outlying buildings and clinics can be challenging, however, communication and working together virtually has become the norm, and the system has adapted with the changing times. I personally feel as though this has helped to bridge the gaps and break down the silos we all often work in, however, this could be challenging for some.

review_title: PC Tech - Toxic, Hostile, and Passive Work Environment!!! STAY AWAY!!!
pros: Engaging, fast-paced, a lot of entry-level aspects learned within desktop support.
cons:
Working at the help desk, co-workers were toxic, passive, and childish.  A lot of back-stabbing  around the small knit department.

Management is more focused on friendships with subordinates and allowing a hostile work environment to take place.

Personal conversations were recorded without knowledge or consent; which were then used for blackmailing purposes.

Upper Management handled the situation unprofessionally with unethical practices and no regard for an appeal.

Was told "its not about the work, but how you get along with your co-workers". A previous employee before my own was fired along similar guidelines.

Sexual harassment and wrongful termination cloud what could be a positive and engaging job aspect.

review_title: Good place to work, great pay
pros: The staff is friendly and helpful for the most part. Management is great about working with staff as far as adjusting schedules if you want to attend school or have some type of emergency. There are also great education incentives. You can almost always pick up extra shifts if you want to make a little extra money.
cons: It is sometimes hard to get days off if you do not plan far in advance. Frequent mandates.

pros: Pleasant people, are needed in community, good salary,good colleagues,good location,up to date facilities ,being the provider for Fort Drum.
cons: Being in the snow belt can be a problem. Nearby housing is limited. Because of the weather house upkeep can be an issue. Change occurs slowly.

pros: In a high needs area so jobs are fairly secure for long term employment.  Great educational incentives and staff is paid competitively.
cons: Some parts of hospital has poor design construction particularly in the ER setting.  Often not able to accommodate patient demand and process falls into bottleneck effect.
